member.name: T:TeamDynamix.Api.Assets.AssetSearch
member.summary: A set of filtering options used for searching assets.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Assets.AssetSearch.SerialLike
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to perform a LIKE search on for the asset serial number and tag.
member.value: The text to perform a LIKE search on for the asset serial number and tag.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Assets.AssetSearch.SearchText
member.summary: Gets or sets the search text to filter on. If this is set, this will sort the results by their text relevancy.
member.value: The search text.
member.remarks:
Text search incorporates the following elements:
Asset tag
Asset serial number
Asset serial number
Supplier name
Product model name
Manufacturer name

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Assets.AssetSearch.SavedSearchID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the saved search this search is associated with.
member.value: The saved search ID to filter based on.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current status IDs to filter on. Only assets that currently have one of these statuses will be included.
member.value: The status IDs to filter on.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Assets.AssetSearch.ExternalIDs
member.summary: Gets or sets the external IDs to filter on. Only assets that have one of these external ID values will be included.
member.value: The external ID values to filter on.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Assets.AssetSearch.IsInService

member.value: The historical status IDs to filter on.

member.summary: Gets or sets the manufacturer IDs to filter on. Only assets that are manufactured by one of these vendors will be included.

member.name: T:TeamDynamix.Api.Capacity.CapacityReportPage
member.summary: Represents a page of data needed to render capacity planning information. Capacity data is very large and must be handled in a paged manner. As such, each page will contain a number of rows from the ultimate dataset. These results must be reassembled client-side once all pages have been retrieved. Once this occurs, the dataset can be interpreted and rendered properly.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application.
member.value: The name of the application.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Cmdb.ConfigurationItem.FormID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the form. If a value of 0 is provided, then the default configuration item form for the application will be used.
member.value: The ID of the form.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Cmdb.ConfigurationItem.FormName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the form.
member.value: The name of the form.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Cmdb.ConfigurationItem.IsSystemMaintained
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this configuration item is maintained automatically by the system.
member.value: true if this configuration item is system-maintained; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Assets and Service Catalog services are two examples of system-maintained configuration items, as they are backed by those appropriate systems but still have alternate representations as configuration items.
System-maintained configuration items cannot, for the most part, be modified directly, although their relationships can be modified.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Cmdb.ConfigurationItem.BackingItemID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the underlying TeamDynamix item in the system that this configuration item represents.
member.value: The ID of the underlying TeamDynamix item in the system that this configuration item represents.

remarks.para: In the case of system-maintained configuration items, this will have the ID of the underlying item, such as an asset or service ID, that this configuration item represents.
The specific type of underlying item can be identified using the BackingItemType property.
In the case of configuration items that are not system-maintained, this will be functionally equivalent to the ID.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Cmdb.ConfigurationItem.BackingItemType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the underlying TeamDynamix item in the system that this configuration item represents.
member.value: The type of the underlying TeamDynamix item in the system that this configuration item represents.

remarks.para: In the case of system-maintained configuration items, this will have the type of the underlying item, such as Asset or Service.
In the case of configuration items that are not system-maintained, this will be a value of ConfigurationItem.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name.
member.value: The name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the custom attributes associated with the configuration item. Only supported for configuration items that are not system-maintained. member.name: T:TeamDynamix.Api.Feed.TicketTaskFeedEntry
member.summary: A feed entry for a ticket task.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Feed.TicketTaskFeedEntry.PercentComplete
member.summary: Sets the percent complete of the ticket task. A value must be provided for either this field or the Comments field.
member.remarks:
If a percent complete is not provided for an update to a ticket task, the previously set value will be used.
In the case of maintenance activities, this can only be set to 0 or 100, to indicate whether or not the maintenance activity has been completed or not. Otherwise, this value must be a multiple of 10 between 0 and 100.
member.returns: The percent complete of the ticket task.

member.name: T:TeamDynamix.Api.JsonPatchOperation
member.summary: Describes a single operation to execute as part of a JSON patch.
member.remarks: For more information on the JSON patch format, see jsonpatch.com.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.JsonPatchOperation.op
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the JSON patch operation being performed.
member.value: The name of the JSON patch operation being performed.
member.remarks:
The following operations are currently supported:
add
remove
replace
copy
move
The test operation is NOT supported.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.JsonPatchOperation.path
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON pointer to the field to update. This is required for all operations.
member.value: The JSON pointer to the field to update.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.JsonPatchOperation.from
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON pointer to the source field. This is required for the copy and move operations.
member.value: The JSON pointer to the source field.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.JsonPatchOperation.value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to use for the operation. This is required for add and replace operations.
member.value: The value to use for the operation.

member.value: true if this task can be shifted forward; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Plans.Task.ShiftForwardDate
member.summary: Gets the earliest date to which the task can be shifted forward.
member.value: The earliest date to which the task can be shifted forward.
member.remarks:
A task will not be shifted forward under any of the following circumstances:
The task is a parent task
The task is completed
The task has no predecessors
The resulting date would be after the current start date of the task

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Plans.Plan.DraftID
member.summary: Gets or sets the current draft ID.
member.value: The draft ID or 0 for no associated draft.
member.remarks: When someone is editing a plan in the new web plan manager system, their edits will be assigned a DraftID. In-place edits will be saved to the DraftID but will not be pushed to the actual plan until the user chooses to Check In their Draft. Under this system, the plan can either have a draft ID or none (returning 0).

member.summary: Whether or not the operation succeeded. If this is false, Message should be set. If ErrorID is greater than zero, this represents that an error occurred, otherwise this when this is false the application is assumed to have encountered an issue with the inputted values as described in Message.
member.returns: Whether or not the operation succeeded

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.PlanUpdates.ErrorID
member.summary: An ID of an exception that occurred on the server as a result of this operation. If this is set, Succeeded should be false, but Succeeded can be false without an ErrorID present. This is common for validation issues with invalid values coming in to an operation.
member.returns: An error ID corresponding with any error that occurred.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.PlanUpdates.Message

member.summary: Gets or sets the full name of the requestor. This field is required on ticket creation when requestor creation is enabled and a valid requestor UID has not been provided.

value.para: The full name of the requestor.
This can be specified on creation if the UID of a requestor has not been specified.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.Ticket.RequestorFirstName
member.summary: Gets or sets the first name of the requestor.
member.value: The first name of the requestor.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.Ticket.RequestorLastName
member.summary: Gets or sets the last name of the requestor.
member.value: The last name of the requestor.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.Ticket.RequestorEmail
member.summary: Gets or sets the email address of the requestor. This field is required on ticket creation when requestor creation is enabled and a valid requestor UID has not been provided.

value.para: The email address of the requestor.

This can be specified on creation if the UID of a requestor has not been specified. When this is the case, the system will attempt to automatically match the email address to an existing person record.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.Ticket.RequestorPhone
member.summary: Gets or sets the phone number of the requestor.

value.para: The phone number of the requestor.
This can be specified on creation if the UID of a requestor has not been specified.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.Ticket.RequestorUid
member.summary: Gets or sets the UID of the requestor.
member.value: The UID of the requestor. In the interests of capturing information, this field is not required on ticket creation. If this field is not specified on creation, the system will attempt to perform matching based on the submitted requestor's email address, and optionally can create new requestors based on the submitted name and email.

remarks.para: In the interests of capturing information, this field is not required on ticket creation. If this field is not specified on creation, the system will attempt to perform matching based on the submitted requestor's email address, and optionally can create new requestors based on the submitted name and email.
However, subsequent edits require a requestor.

member.summary: The different options when creating a new ticket.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.TicketCreateOptions.EnableNotifyReviewer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether reviewer notification should be enabled. Even if this value is true, the reviewer will not necessarily be notified unless it is explicitly specified on the ticket's type.
member.value: true if reviewer notification should be enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.TicketCreateOptions.NotifyRequestor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the requestor should be notified.
member.value: true if the requestor should be notified; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.TicketCreateOptions.NotifyResponsible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the responsible resource(s) should be notified.
member.value: true if the responsible resource(s) should be notified; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.TicketCreateOptions.AllowRequestorCreation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a requestor should be created if an existing person with matching information cannot be found.
member.value: true if a requestor should be created if an existing person with matching information cannot be found; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: On ticket creation, when a requestor UID is not provided, it will first attempt to match to a user or customer in the People database based on the requestor's email if it has been provided. This option governs if, after all else has failed, a new requestor should be created.

To use this option, the individual must have access to the TDPeople application in addition to the "Person: Create and modify individuals in the People database" permission. If a first name, last name, and/or email cannot be determined, the requestor record will not be created.

member.summary: Gets or sets the filter to use for and with regards to ticket tasks.

The filter to use for responsibility as it pertains to ticket tasks.
A value of true indicates that only completed ticket tasks should be incorporated in the results, whereas a value of false indicates that only active, incomplete ticket tasks should be incorporated in the results.

member.summary: Gets or sets the IDs of the associated CIs to filter on. To be included in the search results, a ticket must be associated with one or more of the listed CIs.
member.value: The IDs of the associated CIs to filter on.
member.remarks: This replaces the previous AssetIDs property. Since assets are a subset of configuration items, asset filtering can still be performed by ensuring that the configuration item ID of each asset is specified instead.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Tickets.TicketSearch.ExcludeConfigurationItemIDs

member.value: The IDs of the associated CIs to exclude on.
member.remarks: This replaces the previous ExcludeAssetIDs property. Since assets are a subset of configuration items, asset filtering can still be performed by ensuring that the configuration item ID of each asset is specified instead.

member.name: T:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode
member.summary: A list of error codes to help the user understand item errors for time API operations.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.Unknown
member.summary: Represents an unknown / unexpected error

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.ServerError
member.summary: An exception occurred on the server while processing the request and prevented the request from completing properly.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidTimeEntryID
member.summary: The time entry identifier was either not specified when it was required or was an unsupported value. See the error message for more details.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidModuleType
member.summary: Occurs when you attempt to change a time entry's component after it already exists or to a component that does not support time entry.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidProjectID
member.summary: Occurs when a project ID is required but not specified or specified to a negative value.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidPlanID
member.summary: Occurs when a plan ID is required but not specified or specified to a negative value.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidItemID
member.summary: Occurs when an item ID is required but not specified or specified to a negative value.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidAppID
member.summary: Occurs when an application ID is required but not specified or specified to a negative value.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.UserNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when no user with the specified unique identifier could be found. They either do not exist, are deactivated, or are not visible to the user executing the request.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TimeEntryNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to act on a time entry that already exists but either is deleted, has an incorrect ID specified, or is not visible to the executing user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TimeAccountNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to add time to an item when the specified time account is not available for that item.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TaskNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on a Task that either is deleted, has an incorrect ID specified, or is not visible to the executing user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.IssueNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on an Issue that either is deleted, has an incorrect ID specified, or is not visible to the executing user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TicketNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on a Ticket that either is deleted, has an incorrect ID specified, or is not visible to the executing user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TicketTaskNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on a Ticket Task that either is deleted, has an incorrect ID specified, or is not visible to the executing user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TicketConvertedToTask
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on a Ticket that has already been converted to a Task. You should enter time against the task instead.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.ProjectNotFound
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on a Project, Issue, or Task where the related project has been deleted.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.UserDoesNotHaveApplication
member.summary: Occurs when the user the time entry belongs to does not have the Time and Expenses application or the application that contains the item they're trying to add time to.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.UserIsNotOnProject
member.summary: Occurs when a user the time entry will be for is not an approved member of the project.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.CannotAddTimeForOthers
member.summary: Occurs when you are trying to add time for another user but you do not have the permission to add time for other users.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.CannotViewTimeEntry
member.summary: Occurs when you are trying to view time that you do not have permissions to view.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.UserInvalid
member.summary: Occurs when the user the time entry belongs to is not active or is not a standard user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TimeReportAlreadyApproved
member.summary: The time report the entry would belong to has already been approved.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TimeReportAlreadySubmitted
member.summary: The time report the entry would belong to has already been submitted.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TimeEntryOccursOnLockedDate
member.summary: The time entry occurs on a date that is locked.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.TimeAccountLimitExceeded
member.summary: The time account is limited and the edit or addition would move the user over their limit for a specific period of time.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.LimitedTimeCannotBeNegative
member.summary: Occurs when a user edits or adds a time entry on a limited time type that would make the time entry negative.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.CannotChangeProperty
member.summary: Occurs when the value of a property that cannot be edited is modified. If you need to change this value, you should instead delete the time entry and add a new time entry.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.MaxOperationsPerRequestExceeded
member.summary: Occurs when too many operations are included in a single bulk operation.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.NoOperationsSpecified
member.summary: Occurs when a bulk operation occurred but no operations were specified.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.ProjectNotActive
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with time on a project, issue, or task when the project is no longer active.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.ProjectTimeEntryNotAllowed
member.summary: Occurs when trying to enter time at the project level but the project does not support project-level time entry.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.LimitedTimeTypesUnavailable
member.summary: Occurs when trying to work with limited time types on components that don't support them.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.CannotDeleteTimeEntry
member.summary: Occurs when trying to delete a time entry for another user.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidTimeDate
member.summary: Occurs when required timedate is not provided.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeApiErrorCode.InvalidTicketID
member.summary: Occurs when a ticket ID is required but not specified or specified to a negative value.

member.summary: Gets or sets a collection error messages. Each message corresponds to an entry in the FailureIDs collection at the same index in the list.
member.value: The error messages.

member.summary: Specifies the approval status of a time/expense entry or report.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeStatus.NoStatus
member.summary: The time/expense entry (or report) has not been submitted for approval.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeStatus.Submitted
member.summary: The time/expense entry (or report) has been submitted for approval but not reviewed.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeStatus.Rejected
member.summary: The time/expense entry (or report) has been submitted and rejected. For a , this indicates that one or more transactions in the report were rejected.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.Time.TimeStatus.Approved
member.summary: The time/expense entry (or report) has been submitted and approved. For a , this indicates that all transactions in the report were approved.

A member of the group.
Any type of field that is a List, such as Attributes and Permissions, is only returned when a single user is selected. These collection fields are excluded from the data returned in a member search to increase performance.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the system application to filter on.

member.value: The name of the system application to filter on.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Users.NewUser.AuthenticationUserName
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication username of the new user. This username is what will be used when authenticating rather than the standard username field. This field only applies to non-TeamDynamix authentication types. This value should be unique across all username and authentication usernames in your organization. If the provided value is not unique, it will be ignored. This only applies to Users and will be ignored when creating Customers.
member.value: The user's authentication username.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Users.NewUser.AuthenticationProviderID
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication provider this user will use to authenticate by its ID. Leave this value blank to specify TeamDynamix or when using SSO authentication. This value can be obtained from the Admin application Authentication section by one of your organization's administrators who has access to modify authentication settings. If an invalid value is provided, this will use the default authentication provider for the organization. This only applies to Users and will be ignored when creating Customers.
member.value: The user's authentication provider.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Users.User.AuthenticationUserName
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication username of the new user. This username is what will be used when authenticating rather than the standard username field. This field only applies to non-TeamDynamix authentication types. This value should be unique across all username and authentication usernames in your organization. If the provided value is not unique, it will be ignored. This only applies to Users. Customers will always have this set to an empty string.
member.value: The user's authentication username.

member.name: P:TeamDynamix.Api.Users.User.AuthenticationProviderID
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication provider this user will use to authenticate by its ID. Leave this value blank to specify TeamDynamix or when using SSO authentication. This value can be obtained from the Admin application Authentication section by one of your organization's administrators who has access to modify authentication settings. If an invalid value is provided, this will use the default authentication provider for the organization. This only applies to Users, not Customers. Customers will always have this set to null.
member.value: The user's authentication provider.

member.summary: Gets or sets the search text to perform LIKE-based filtering on.
member.value: The search text to perform LIKE-based filtering on.
member.remarks:
This will perform a LIKE search on the following columns:
Full name
Username (for TeamDynamix users)
External ID
Alternate ID
The maximum length of this is 50 characters.

member.summary: Describes the different ways in which a workflow progresses in response to actions being taken on workflow steps.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowAdvancement.None
member.summary: An unknown or indeterminate value.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowAdvancement.Approve
member.summary: Indicates that the workflow is moving forward as the result of an approval or other affirmative action.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowAdvancement.Reject
member.summary: Indicates that the workflow is moving backward as the result of an rejection or other denial action.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowAdvancement.Complete
member.summary: Indicates that a workflow is advancing as the result of an item's completion.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowAdvancement.Neutral
member.summary: Indicates that the workflow is not being advanced.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowAdvancement.Skip
member.summary: Indicates that a workflow is advancing as the result of skipping an item.

member.summary: Describes the different statuses that a workflow may have.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowStatus.None

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowStatus.Approved
member.summary: Indicates that the workflow as a whole was completed and the result was that the item was approved.

member.name: F:TeamDynamix.Api.WorkflowEngine.WorkflowStatus.Rejected
member.summary: Indicates that the workflow as a whole was completed and the result was that the item was rejected.
